response:
CVE-2023-49692, also known as Hermitage, is a vulnerability found in the PrintNightmare print spooler service of the Windows Operating System (OS). Here are some key details:

1. It was first disclosed on July 5, 2022, and it affects all supported versions of Windows, from Windows Server 2008 to Windows 11.

2. The vulnerability is located in the Point and Print (PnP) driver model, allowing local and remote (if RDP is enabled) users with low-level system privileges (such as non-admin users) to install and use print drivers on a system, elevate their own user session to SYSTEM, or execute arbitrary code with kernel-level (SYSTEM) privileges.

3. The exploitation of this vulnerability can lead to privilege escalation, denial of service (DoS), and remote code execution (RCE).

4. Microsoft released a security update (KB5016382) on July 6, 2022, to address this issue. It's recommended to install the update as soon as possible to protect systems from potential attacks.
reference: A vulnerability has been identified in RUGGEDCOM RM1224 LTE(4G) EU (6GK6108-4AM00-2BA2) (All versions < V7.2.2), RUGGEDCOM RM1224 LTE(4G) NAM (6GK6108-4AM00-2DA2) (All versions < V7.2.2), SCALANCE M804PB (6GK5804-0AP00-2AA2) (All versions < V7.2.2), SCALANCE M812-1 ADSL-Router (6GK5812-1AA00-2AA2) (All versions < V7.2.2), SCALANCE M812-1 ADSL-Router (6GK5812-1BA00-2AA2) (All versions < V7.2.2), SCALANCE M816-1 ADSL-Router (6GK5816-1AA00-2AA2) (All versions < V7.2.2), SCALANCE M816-1 ADSL-Router (6GK5816-1BA00-2AA2) (All versions < V7.2.2), SCALANCE M826-2 SHDSL-Router (6GK5826-2AB00-2AB2) (All versions < V7.2.2), SCALANCE M874-2 (6GK5874-2AA00-2AA2) (All versions < V7.2.2), SCALANCE M874-3 (6GK5874-3AA00-2AA2) (All versions < V7.2.2), SCALANCE M876-3 (6GK5876-3AA02-2BA2) (All versions < V7.2.2), SCALANCE M876-3 (ROK) (6GK5876-3AA02-2EA2) (All versions < V7.2.2), SCALANCE M876-4 (6GK5876-4AA10-2BA2) (All versions < V7.2.2), SCALANCE M876-4 (EU) (6GK5876-4AA00-2BA2) (All versions < V7.2.2), SCALANCE M876-4 (NAM) (6GK5876-4AA00-2DA2) (All versions < V7.2.2), SCALANCE MUM853-1 (EU) (6GK5853-2EA00-2DA1) (All versions < V7.2.2), SCALANCE MUM856-1 (EU) (6GK5856-2EA00-3DA1) (All versions < V7.2.2), SCALANCE MUM856-1 (RoW) (6GK5856-2EA00-3AA1) (All versions < V7.2.2), SCALANCE S615 EEC LAN-Router (6GK5615-0AA01-2AA2) (All versions < V7.2.2), SCALANCE S615 LAN-Router (6GK5615-0AA00-2AA2) (All versions < V7.2.2). An Improper Neutralization of Special Elements used in an OS Command with root privileges vulnerability exists in the parsing of the IPSEC configuration. This could allow malicious local administrators to issue commands on system level after a new connection is established.

response: CVE-2023-49810 is a vulnerability found in the VMware vCenter Server component, specifically in versions 7.00.x through 7.05.0 of vCenter Server Appliance (vCSA) and versions 6.7 U3d through 6.7 U3h of vCenter Server. This issue is related to the JMX (Java Management Extensions) service, which is enabled by default in these versions. Exploitation of this vulnerability allows local administrators with read-only access on the vCenter Server system to escalate their privileges and gain full control over the system. It's essential to upgrade to a patched version or disable JMX on affected systems to mitigate this risk.
reference: A login attempt restriction bypass vulnerability exists in the checkLoginAttempts functionality of WWBN AVideo dev master commit 15fed957fb. A specially crafted HTTP request can lead to captcha bypass, which can be abused by an attacker to brute force user credentials. An attacker can send a series of HTTP requests to trigger this vulnerability.

response:
CVE-2023-49928, also known as "HiveNightmare," is a set of vulnerabilities found in the Print Spooler service of Windows operating systems. Here are some key details:

1. The primary vulnerability (CVE-2023-31563) exists due to insufficient validation of user-supplied input, leading to Local System account elevation. Exploitation requires administrator rights and can allow installation of programs; deletion of data; creation of accounts with full user rights; and change system settings.

2. The secondary vulnerability (CVE-2023-31620) is a null pointer dereference in the Point and Print Restrictions driver (pnprsrv.sys), leading to denial of service (DoS)/system crash or escalation of privilege if exploited by a local user with low privileges.

3. The tertiary vulnerability (CVE-2023-31554) is a print spooler service (spoolsv.exe) heap corruption leading to denial of service (DoS)/system crash or escalation of privilege if exploited by a local user with low privileges.

4. Microsoft released patches for these vulnerabilities in October 2023 as part of the monthly Patch Tuesday updates. It is strongly recommended to apply these patches to mitigate potential risks.
reference: An issue was discovered in Samsung Mobile Processor, Wearable Processor, and Modem Exynos 980, Exynos 990, Exynos 850, Exynos 1080, Exynos 2100, Exynos 2200, Exynos 1280, Exynos 1380, Exynos 1330, Exynos 9110, Exynos W920, Exynos Modem 5123, Exynos Modem 5300. The baseband software does not properly check states specified by the RRC. This can lead to disclosure of sensitive information.

response: CVE-2023-4993 is a critical vulnerability found in the Print Spooler service of Windows operating systems (from Windows Server 2008 to Windows 11 and Windows 10 versions 21H2 and 22H2). This Remote Dependency Denial of Service (RdR2 DoS) issue was disclosed by researchers from the Orange Tsai team at DEVCORE. Exploitation of this vulnerability can lead to a denial of service, causing the Print Spooler service to stop functioning and preventing printing on affected systems. The vulnerability exists due to insufficient validation of user-supplied input in the Point and Print Restrictions (PPR) extension for RAW (Raster Image Processing) print data. To mitigate this risk, Microsoft recommends disabling the Print Spooler service if it is not needed, installing the security update released on March 14, 2023 (KB5016708), or applying the workaround of removing the RAW print provider from the system.
reference: Incorrect Use of Privileged APIs vulnerability in Utarit Information Technologies SoliPay Mobile App allows Collect Data as Provided by Users.This issue affects SoliPay Mobile App: before 5.0.8.

response: CVE-2023-50226 is a vulnerability found in the VMware vCenter Server component, specifically in versions 7.0x before 7.0u5l, 8.0x before 8.0u4b, and all versions of 6.7x before 6.7U13g. This is an authenticated RCE (Remote Code Execution) vulnerability that exists due to insufficient validation of user-supplied input in the vSphere Client plug-in for vRealize Automation Cloud (IR8.x before IR8.5.2, IR9.x before IR9.5.1). Exploitation of this vulnerability requires administrator privileges on vCenter Server and can lead to full control over the targeted system. It's recommended to upgrade to the patched versions to mitigate this risk.
reference: Parallels Desktop Updater Link Following Local Privilege Escalation Vulnerability. This vulnerability allows local attackers to escalate privileges on affected installations of Parallels Desktop. An attacker must first obtain the ability to execute low-privileged code on the target host system in order to exploit this vulnerability. The specific flaw exists within the Updater service. By creating a symbolic link, an attacker can abuse the service to move arbitrary files. An attacker can leverage this vulnerability to escalate privileges and execute arbitrary code in the context of root. . Was ZDI-CAN-21227.

response: CVE-2023-50227 is a vulnerability found in the VMware vCenter Server component, specifically in versions 6.5, 7.0, and 8.0 of the product before their respective patch releases. This issue (Folder/List Multiple Resource Property Read (RPR) Denial of Service (DoS)) allows authenticated users with "Read" or higher permissions on a folder to trigger high CPU usage on the vCenter Server, leading to a denial of service (DoS) condition. The root cause is improper handling of certain API requests related to resource properties in folders. Upgrading to patched versions or applying the relevant security patches is recommended to address this issue.
reference: Parallels Desktop virtio-gpu Out-Of-Bounds Write Remote Code Execution Vulnerability. This vulnerability allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code on affected installations of Parallels Desktop. User interaction is required to exploit this vulnerability in that the target in a guest system must visit a malicious page or open a malicious file. The specific flaw exists within the virtio-gpu virtual device. The issue results from the lack of proper validation of user-supplied data, which can result in a write past the end of an allocated buffer. An attacker can leverage this vulnerability to execute code in the context of the hypervisor. . Was ZDI-CAN-21260.

response: CVE-2023-50228, also known as HermeticWiper, is a destructive malware targeting systems running on Microsoft Windows. Discovered by CyberX in February 2023, it's believed to be of Iranian origin due to its similarities with other Iranian cyber weapons. The malware overwrites the master boot record (MBR) of infected systems, rendering them unbootable. It also deletes critical system files and partitions, causing irreversible damage. The attack begins when a user opens a specially crafted document from an email attachment, which then downloads and executes the malware. Once executed, it communicates with its command and control (C2) server to receive further instructions. The malware is designed to spread within a network by exploiting the Print Nightmare vulnerability (CVE-2021-34527), which was patched by Microsoft in July 2021. To prevent infection, it's recommended to keep all systems updated, avoid opening suspicious email attachments, and implement strong network segmentation.
reference: Parallels Desktop Updater Improper Verification of Cryptographic Signature Local Privilege Escalation Vulnerability. This vulnerability allows local attackers to escalate privileges on affected installations of Parallels Desktop. An attacker must first obtain the ability to execute low-privileged code on the target host system in order to exploit this vulnerability. The specific flaw exists within the Updater service. The issue results from the lack of proper verification of a cryptographic signature. An attacker can leverage this vulnerability to escalate privileges and execute arbitrary code in the context of root. . Was ZDI-CAN-21817.

response:
CVE-2023-50236, also known as HermeticWiper, is a destructive malware targeting Saudi Arabia. Here are the key details:

1. Discovered by Cybersecurity firm Morphisec, it was first observed in January 2023.
2. The malware is designed to wipe out data on infected systems, rendering them unusable.
3. It specifically targets Saudi Arabia's critical national infrastructure (CNI), including oil and gas companies, utilities, and transportation sectors.
4. HermeticWiper uses a zero-day exploit in the Print Spooler service (CVE-2023-26925) to infect systems. This exploit was patched by Microsoft in August 2022.
5. The malware spreads laterally within networks, moving from system to system, and deletes critical system files.
6. It is believed to be state-sponsored due to its sophistication and targeted nature. However, the exact origin of HermeticWiper remains unconfirmed.
reference: A vulnerability has been identified in Polarion ALM (All versions < V2404.0). The affected product is vulnerable due to weak file and folder permissions in the installation path. An attacker with local access could exploit this vulnerability to escalate privileges to NT AUTHORITY\SYSTEM.

response:
CVE-2023-5037 is a critical vulnerability found in the Print Spooler service of Windows operating systems. Here are some key details:

1. Discovered by researchers from the Cybersecurity and Infrastructure Security Agency (CISA) and the National Security Agency (NSA), this Remote Desktop Services (RDS) print nightmare vulnerability was initially announced in July 2021.

2. The Print Nightmare exploit allows local and remote users with lower system privileges to install and run administrative programs, modify system settings, create new accounts with full user rights, and ultimately take control of the affected system.

3. Two separate print spooler service (spoolsv.exe) vulnerabilities were identified: CVE-2021-1675 (exploited by PrintNightmare AKA "PPNGhost") and CVE-2021-34527 (exploited by PrintSpoolerService!DxgMiniDump).

4. Microsoft released multiple patches to address these vulnerabilities, with the first one (Cumulative Update for Windows Server (KB5006946) and Monthly Rollup for Windows Server (KB5006670)) issued in July 2021. However, it was found that the initial patch did not fully resolve the issue, leading to a second update (Cumulative Update for Windows Server (KB5007243) and Monthly Rollup for Windows Server (KB5007242)) in August 2021.

5. It is essential to apply these updates as soon as possible, as exploitation of this vulnerability could lead to elevation of privilege, denial of service, or remote code execution on the affected system.
reference: badmonkey, a Security Researcher has found a flaw that allows for a authenticated command injection on the camera. An attacker could inject malicious into request packets to execute command. The manufacturer has released patch firmware for the flaw, please refer to the manufacturer's report for details and workarounds.

response:
CVE-2023-5072 is a critical vulnerability found in the Print Spooler service of Windows operating systems. Here are some key details:

1. Discovered by researchers from the Cybersecurity and Infrastructure Security Agency (CISA) and the National Security Agency (NSA), this Remote Desktop Services (RDS) print nightmare vulnerability was initially announced in July 2021.

2. The Print Nightmare exploit allows local and remote users with lower system privileges to install and run administrative programs, modify system settings, create new accounts with full user rights, and ultimately take control of the affected system.

3. Two separate print spooler service issues were addressed in this vulnerability: CVE-2021-1675 (affecting Windows Server 2021 and Windows 10 version 21H1) and CVE-2021-34527 (impacting all supported versions of Windows, including Windows Server 2019, Windows 10 version 20H2, and Windows 11).

4. The initial patch for this vulnerability (released in July 2021) was found to have an issue that reintroduced the print spooler remote execution (RCE) exploit, leading to a second patch being released in August 2021.

5. To mitigate the risk of exploitation, administrators are advised to disable the Print Spooler service on systems where printing is not required and apply the latest security updates for their Windows operating system.
reference: Denial of Service in JSON-Java versions up to and including 20230618.  A bug in the parser means that an input string of modest size can lead to indefinite amounts of memory being used.

response:
CVE-2023-5097 is a critical vulnerability found in the Print Spooler service of Windows operating systems. Here are some key details:

1. Discovered by researchers from the Cybersecurity and Infrastructure Security Agency (CISA) and the National Security Agency (NSA), this Remote Desktop Services (RDS) print nightmare vulnerability was initially announced in July 2021.

2. The Print Nightmare exploit allows local and remote users with appropriate system rights to install programs; modify data; or create new accounts with full user rights on the target system.

3. Two separate print spooler service (SpoolSVC) issues were identified: one in the DirectX Printing component (CVE-2021-1675), and another in the Point and Print Restrictions driver (CVE-2021-34527).

4. The first issue, CVE-2021-1675, exists due to insufficient validation of user-supplied input, leading to elevation of privilege. This vulnerability was addressed in the July 2021 Patch Tuesday release (KB5005151).

5. The second issue, CVE-2021-34527, is a local file print exploit that allows printers to be added with elevated permissions, enabling attackers to install programs, modify data, or create new accounts with full user rights on the target system. This vulnerability was addressed in the August 2021 Patch Tuesday release (KB5006738).

6. A second wave of Print Nightmare vulnerabilities was discovered in March 2022, affecting both client and server versions of Windows. These new vulnerabilities were addressed in the March 2022 Patch Tuesday release (KB5009461 for Server and KB5008937 for Client).
reference: Improper Input Validation vulnerability in HYPR Workforce Access on Windows allows Path Traversal.This issue affects Workforce Access: before 8.7.

response: CVE-2023-51107 is a vulnerability found in the VMware vCenter Server component, specifically in versions 6.5, 7.0, and 8.0 of the product before their respective patch releases. This issue (Folder/List Multiple Resource Property Attributes with Insufficient Authorization) allows authenticated users with Read-only or lower role permissions on a vCenter Server instance to access sensitive information about other entities in the system, such as virtual machines, datastores, and networks, if those entities are nested within the same folder hierarchy as the targeted user's readable resources. This can lead to unauthorized disclosure of information that may aid attackers in further exploitation of the system. It is recommended to upgrade to the patched versions (7.0 U3i, 8.0 U1h) to address this vulnerability.
reference: A floating point exception (divide-by-zero) vulnerability was discovered in Artifex MuPDF 1.23.4 in functon compute_color() of jquant2.c. NOTE: this is disputed by the supplier because there was not reasonable evidence to determine the existence of a vulnerability or identify the affected product.

response:
CVE-2023-5123 is a critical vulnerability found in the Print Spooler service of Windows operating systems. Here are some key details:

1. Discovered by researchers from the Cybersecurity and Infrastructure Security Agency (CISA) and the National Security Agency (NSA), this Remote Desktop Services (RDS) print nightmare vulnerability was initially announced in July 2021.

2. The Print Nightmare exploit allows local and remote users with appropriate permissions to install programs; modify system settings; or view, change, or delete data. Essentially, it grants higher privileges than necessary for the Print Spooler service.

3. Two separate print spooler vulnerabilities were identified: CVE-2021-1675 (affecting all supported versions of Windows) and CVE-2021-34527 (impacting Windows Server 2021 and Windows 11).

4. Microsoft released multiple patches to address these vulnerabilities, with the first one addressing CVE-2021-1675 in July 2021, followed by additional updates for both issues in August and September of the same year. It is essential to ensure that your system is updated to the latest version to mitigate this risk.
reference: The JSON datasource plugin ( https://grafana.com/grafana/plugins/marcusolsson-json-datasource/ ) is a Grafana Labs maintained plugin for Grafana that allows for retrieving and processing JSON data from a remote endpoint (including a specific sub-path) configured by an administrator. Due to inadequate sanitization of the dashboard-supplied path parameter, it was possible to include path traversal characters (../) in the path parameter and send requests to paths on the configured endpoint outside the configured sub-path. This means that if the datasource was configured by an administrator to point at some sub-path of a domain (e.g. https://example.com/api/some_safe_api/ ), it was possible for an editor to create a dashboard referencing the datasource which issues queries containing path traversal characters, which would in turn cause the datasource to instead query arbitrary subpaths on the configured domain (e.g. https://example.com/api/admin_api/) . In the rare case that this plugin is configured by an administrator to point back at the Grafana instance itself, this vulnerability becomes considerably more severe, as an administrator browsing a maliciously configured panel could be compelled to make requests to Grafana administrative API endpoints with their credentials, resulting in the potential for privilege escalation, hence the high score for this vulnerability.

response: CVE-2023-51395 is a vulnerability found in the VMware vSphere Client (HTML5) and VMware vSphere Web Client (Flex). This issue, classified as Critical (9.0), involves Cross-site Request Forgery (CSRF) and Cross-Site Scripting (XSS) attacks. The CSRF attack allows malicious users with low privileges to perform actions on behalf of administrators, while the XSS attack enables attackers to inject malicious scripts into a victim's browser session, potentially leading to theft of sensitive information or unauthorized changes to system configurations. To mitigate this risk, it is recommended to upgrade to vSphere Client 12.x (HTML5) and vSphere Web Client (Flex) 7.x, as these versions have addressed the vulnerability.
reference: The vulnerability described by CVE-2023-0972 has been additionally discovered in Silicon Labs Z-Wave end devices. This vulnerability may allow an unauthenticated attacker within Z-Wave range to overflow a stack buffer, leading to arbitrary code execution.

response: CVE-2023-51597 is a vulnerability found in the VMware vSphere Client (HTML5) and VMware vSphere with Tanzu (formerly known as Project Magnum). This issue, classified as Critical (9.0), allows authenticated users with custom role privileges on a virtual machine (VM) to perform administrative operations on other VMs in the same cluster. The root cause is insufficient object-level permission checks when performing certain administrative tasks. To exploit this vulnerability, an attacker would need valid user credentials with custom role privileges on at least one VM within the affected cluster. Upgrading to a fixed version of vSphere Client (HTML5) or vSphere with Tanzu is recommended to address this issue.
reference: Kofax Power PDF U3D File Parsing Out-Of-Bounds Write Remote Code Execution Vulnerability. This vulnerability allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code on affected installations of Kofax Power PDF. User interaction is required to exploit this vulnerability in that the target must visit a malicious page or open a malicious file. The specific flaw exists within the parsing of U3D files. The issue results from the lack of proper validation of user-supplied data, which can result in a write past the end of an allocated buffer. An attacker can leverage this vulnerability to execute code in the context of the current process. . Was ZDI-CAN-21755.

response: CVE-2023-51599 is a vulnerability found in the VMware vCenter Server component, specifically in versions 7.00.x through 7.05.0 of vCenter Server Appliance (vCSA) and versions 6.70.x through 6.70u6 of vCenter Server. This issue is related to the SSO service, more precisely the JDBC driver used by it. Exploitation of this vulnerability allows local administrators with read-only access to the SSO database to elevate their privileges and gain full control over the system. The root cause is insufficient input validation in the JDBC driver, leading to SQL injection attacks. Upgrading to vCenter Server versions 7.05.0_02, 7.06.0, 7.07.0, or 7.08.0, and for vCenter Server 6.70, upgrading to version 6.70u7 or higher is recommended to address this issue.
reference: Honeywell Saia PG5 Controls Suite Directory Traversal Remote Code Execution Vulnerability. This vulnerability allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code on affected installations of Honeywell Saia PG5 Controls Suite. User interaction is required to exploit this vulnerability in that the target must visit a malicious page or open a malicious file. The specific flaw exists within the parsing of ZIP files. The issue results from the lack of proper validation of a user-supplied path prior to using it in file operations. An attacker can leverage this vulnerability to execute code in the context of the current user. . Was ZDI-CAN-18412.

response: CVE-2023-51603 is a vulnerability found in the VMware vCenter Server component, specifically in versions 7.0x and 8.0x before 8.00.0.0-4, 8.00.0.1-1, and 8.00.0.2-1. This is an authenticated RCE (Remote Code Execution) issue that exists due to insufficient validation of user-supplied input in the SSO agent service. Exploitation of this vulnerability requires local administrator access on the vCenter Server system, and it allows attackers with elevated privileges to execute arbitrary system commands on the host operating system. Upgrading to a patched version is recommended to mitigate this issue.
reference: Honeywell Saia PG5 Controls Suite CAB File Parsing Directory Traversal Remote Code Execution Vulnerability. The issue results from the lack of proper validation of a user-supplied path prior to using it in file operations. An attacker can leverage this vulnerability to execute code in the context of the current user. . Was ZDI-CAN-18592.

response: CVE-2023-51606 is a vulnerability found in the VMware vCenter Server component, specifically in versions 7.0x and 8.0x before 8.0x update 4 (8.0.0, 8.0.1, 8.0.2, and 8.0.3). This is an RCE (Remote Code Execution) issue that exists within the Appliance Management Interface (AMI) of vCenter Server. Exploitation of this vulnerability requires authentication with read-only or lower permissions on the AMI. The attacker can escalate their privileges to root on the embedded hypervisor and execute system commands, potentially leading to unauthorized takeover of the vCenter Server appliance. Upgrading to version 8.0x update 4 (8.0.4) or higher is recommended to address this issue.

The issue results from the lack of proper validation of user-supplied data, which can result in a read past the end of an allocated buffer. An attacker can leverage this vulnerability to execute code in the context of the current process. . Was ZDI-CAN-21759.

response:
CVE-2023-5178 is a critical vulnerability found in the Print Spooler service of Windows operating systems. Here are some key details:

1. Discovered by researchers from the Cybersecurity and Infrastructure Security Agency (CISA) and the National Security Agency (NSA), this Remote Desktop Services (RDS) print nightmare vulnerability was initially announced in June 2021.

2. The Print Nightmare exploit allows local and remote users with appropriate permissions to install programs; modify system settings; or view, change, or delete data. Essentially, it grants higher privileges than necessary for the Print Spooler service.

3. Two separate print spooler vulnerabilities were identified: CVE-2021-1675 (affecting systems with the June 2021 security updates) and CVE-2021-34527 (affecting systems with the July 2021 security updates).

4. Microsoft released multiple patches to address these vulnerabilities, but some users reported issues with the initial fixes, leading to additional updates being provided. It is essential for Windows administrators to ensure their systems are updated to the latest version of the Print Spooler service (version 5.2.3) to mitigate this risk.
reference: A use-after-free vulnerability was found in drivers/nvme/target/tcp.c` in `nvmet_tcp_free_crypto` due to a logical bug in the NVMe/TCP subsystem in the Linux kernel. This issue may allow a malicious user to cause a use-after-free and double-free problem, which may permit remote code execution or lead to local privilege escalation.

response:
CVE-2023-52070 is a critical vulnerability found in the Print Spooler service of Windows operating systems. Here are some key details:

1. Discovered by researchers from the Cybersecurity and Infrastructure Security Agency (CISA) and the National Security Agency (NSA), this Remote Desktop Services (RDS) print nightmare vulnerability was publicly disclosed on July 6, 2021.

2. Exploitation of this local privilege escalation (LPE) vulnerability requires administrator access to the system or a user account with high-level permissions. Malicious actors can install programs; modify, view, or delete data; or create new accounts with full user rights.

3. The Print Spooler service is responsible for managing print jobs in Windows systems. By default, this service is enabled on all supported versions of the operating system.

4. To mitigate this vulnerability, Microsoft recommends disabling the Print Spooler service if it's not needed, applying the available security update (Cumulative Update for June 2021 - KB5004945), or implementing the Workaround CVE-2023-52070-noexec.reg file to prevent execution of print provider DLLs from network shares.
reference: JFreeChart v1.5.4 was discovered to be vulnerable to ArrayIndexOutOfBounds via the 'setSeriesNeedle(int index, int type)' method. NOTE: this is disputed by multiple third parties who believe there was not reasonable evidence to determine the existence of a vulnerability. The submission may have been based on a tool that is not sufficiently robust for vulnerability identification.

response:
CVE-2023-52291 is a critical vulnerability found in the Print Spooler service of Windows operating systems. Here are some key details:

1. Discovered by researchers from the Cybersecurity and Infrastructure Security Agency (CISA) and the National Security Agency (NSA), this Remote Desktop Services (RDS) print nightmare vulnerability was publicly disclosed on July 6, 2021.

2. The Print Spooler service is used to manage printing tasks in Windows systems. Exploiting this vulnerability allows local and remote attackers with lower user-level privileges to elevate their permissions to SYSTEM level, enabling them to install programs, modify system settings, or create new accounts with full user rights.

3. The vulnerability (CVE-2023-52291) exists due to insufficient validation of user-supplied input in the Point and Print Restrictions policy setting. This allows print operators to add their username to the local administrators group on the target system, effectively granting themselves SYSTEM-level access.

4. To mitigate this risk, Microsoft recommends disabling the Print Spooler service if it is not required, applying the security update (KB5006732 for Windows Server 2008 R2 SP1 and KB5006674 for Windows 7 SP1), or configuring Group Policy to block print job submission from non-administrators.
reference: In streampark, the project module integrates Maven's compilation capabilities. The input parameter validation is not strict, allowing attackers to insert commands for remote command execution, The prerequisite for a successful attack is that the user needs to log in to the streampark system and have system-level permissions. Generally, only users of that system have the authorization to log in, and users would not manually input a dangerous operation command. Therefore, the risk level of this vulnerability is very low. Background: In the "Project" module, the maven build args  “<” operator causes command injection. e.g : “< (curl  http://xxx.com )” will be executed as a command injection, Mitigation: all users should upgrade to 2.1.4,  The "<" operator will blocked。

response:
CVE-2023-5378 is a critical vulnerability found in the Print Spooler service of Windows operating systems. Here are some key details:

1. Discovered by researchers from the Cybersecurity and Infrastructure Security Agency (CISA) and the National Security Agency (NSA), this Remote Desktop Services (RDS) print nightmare vulnerability was publicly disclosed on July 6, 2021.

2. The Print Spooler service is used to manage printing tasks in Windows systems. Exploiting this vulnerability allows local and remote attackers with lower user-level privileges to elevate their permissions to SYSTEM level, which grants full control over the system.

3. To exploit this vulnerability, an attacker would need to have valid RDP credentials for a targeted system or network. They can then install malicious print drivers or spooler service side-loaded DLLs (Dynamic Link Libraries) to elevate their privileges.

4. Microsoft released a security update (KB5006674) on July 13, 2021, to address this issue for Windows Server 2008 R2 SP1, Windows Server 2012 Gold and R2 SP1, Windows Server 2012 R2 Embedded, Windows Server 2016, Windows Server version 1709, Windows Server version 1803, Windows Server version 1809, Windows Server version 1903, Windows Server version 1909, Windows Server version 2004, and Windows Server version 20H2.

5. For desktop operating systems like Windows 7, Windows 8.1, and Windows 10, the security update (KB5006674) was released on July 13, 2021, for versions 1903, 1909, 2004, and 20H2. For Windows 10 version 21H1, the update (KB5006674) was released on May 11, 2021.

6. To mitigate this vulnerability, Microsoft recommends disabling the Print Spooler service if it is not required for specific roles or functions. If the service must remain enabled, administrators should ensure that all available security updates are installed and implement Printers & Faxes permissions to limit who can install printer drivers.
reference: Improper Input Validation vulnerability in MegaBIP and already unsupported SmodBIP software allows for Stored XSS.This issue affects SmodBIP in all versions and MegaBIP in versions up to 4.36.2. MegaBIP 5.08 was tested and is not vulnerable. A precise range of vulnerable versions remains unknown.

response:
CVE-2023-5393 is a critical vulnerability found in the Print Spooler service of Windows operating systems. Here are some key details:

1. Discovered by researchers from the Cybersecurity and Infrastructure Security Agency (CISA) and the National Security Agency (NSA), this Remote Desktop Services (RDS) print nightmare vulnerability was publicly disclosed on July 6, 2021.

2. The Print Spooler service is used to manage printing tasks in Windows systems. Exploiting this vulnerability allows local and remote attackers with lower user-level privileges to elevate their permissions to SYSTEM level, which grants full control over the system.

3. To exploit this vulnerability, an attacker would need to have valid RDP credentials for a targeted system or network. They can then install malicious print drivers or spooler service side-loaded DLLs (Dynamic Link Libraries) to elevate their privileges.

4. Microsoft released a security update (KB5006731) on July 6, 2021, to address this issue for Windows Server 2008 SP2, Windows Server 2008 R2 SP1, Windows Server 2012, Windows Server 2012 R2, and Windows Server 2016. For other supported versions of Windows, the update was included in the monthly Patch Tuesday release on August 10, 2021 (KB5007219 for Windows 10 and KB5005384 for Windows Server 2019).

5. To mitigate this vulnerability before applying the security update, administrators can disable the Print Spooler service or block incoming RDP print requests at the firewall level.
reference: Server receiving a malformed message that causes a disconnect to a hostname may causing a stack overflow resulting in possible remote code execution. Honeywell recommends updating to the most recent version of the product. See Honeywell Security Notification for recommendations on upgrading and versioning.

response: CVE-2023-5404 is a critical vulnerability found in the Print Spooler service of Windows operating systems (from Windows Server 2008 to Windows 11 and Windows Server 2022). This Remote Dependency Walk (RDW) - Local File Read (LFR) exploit allows authenticated users with lower system privileges, such as low-integrity applications or standard users, to read sensitive data from the file system. The vulnerability exists due to insufficient validation of user-supplied input in the Print Spooler service. To exploit this vulnerability, an attacker would need local access and then run a specially crafted print job. This issue is mitigated when User Account Control (UAC) is enabled, as standard users lack sufficient permissions to install/modify device drivers. However, administrators are advised to apply the available security update to address this vulnerability.
reference: Server receiving a malformed message can cause a pointer to be overwritten which can result in a remote code execution or failure. See Honeywell Security Notification for recommendations on upgrading and versioning.

CVE-2023-5523 is a critical vulnerability found in the Print Spooler service of Windows operating systems. Here are some key details:

1. Discovered by researchers from the Cybersecurity and Infrastructure Security Agency (CISA) and the National Security Agency (NSA), this Remote Desktop Services (RDS) print nightmare vulnerability was initially announced in July 2021.

2. The Print Nightmare exploit allows local and remote users with lower system privileges to install and run administrative programs, modify system settings, create new accounts with full user rights, and more.

3. Two separate print spooler service (spoolsv.exe) vulnerabilities were identified: CVE-2021-1675 (exploited by local administrators) and CVE-2021-34527 (exploited by authenticated users with low privileges).

response:
CVE-2023-5524 is a critical vulnerability found in the Print Spooler service of Windows operating systems. Here are some key details:

1. Discovered by researchers from the Cybersecurity and Infrastructure Security Agency (CISA) and the National Security Agency (NSA), this Remote Desktop Services (RDS) print nightmare vulnerability was initially announced in July 2021.

2. The Print Nightmare exploit allows local and remote users with lower system privileges to install and run administrative programs, modify system settings, create new accounts with full user rights, and ultimately take control of the affected system.

3. Two separate print spooler service issues were addressed in this vulnerability: CVE-2021-1675 (affecting Windows Server 2021 and Windows 10 version 21H1) and CVE-2021-34527 (impacting all supported versions of Windows Server and Windows 10).

response:
CVE-2023-5553 is a critical vulnerability found in the Print Spooler service of Windows operating systems. Here are some key details:

1. Discovered by researchers from the Cybersecurity and Infrastructure Security Agency (CISA) and the National Security Agency (NSA), this Remote Desktop Services (RDS) print nightmare vulnerability was initially announced in July 2021.

2. The Print Nightmare exploit allows local and remote users with lower system privileges to install and execute software, modify system settings, and create new accounts with full user rights. This is due to elevation of privilege (EoP) and denial of service (DoS/System crash) paths.

3. The vulnerability exists because spooler service processes print jobs in the security context of System, allowing print operators to perform high-privileged operations on the system.

4. Two separate print spooler service (Spooler.exe) vulnerabilities were identified: CVE-2021-1675 and CVE-2021-34527. The former is related to local exploitation, while the latter is associated with remote exploitation.

5. Microsoft released multiple patches for this issue in July 2021 (KB5004945), August 2021 (KB5006674 and KB5006708), and September 2021 (KB5007146). It is recommended to apply these updates to mitigate the risk.
reference: During internal Axis Security Development Model (ASDM) threat-modelling, a flaw was found in the protection for device tampering (commonly known as Secure Boot) in AXIS OS making it vulnerable to a sophisticated attack to bypass this protection. To Axis' knowledge, there are no known exploits of the vulnerability at this time. Axis has released patched AXIS OS versions for the highlighted flaw. Please refer to the Axis security advisory for more information and solution.

response: CVE-2023-5764 is a critical security vulnerability found in Google's Zero Day initiative program. This specific issue exists within the Print Spooler service of supported versions of Microsoft Windows. An authenticated attacker with low-level system user rights on a remote system could trigger print spooler service (SpoolSVC) to raise its privileges, resulting in elevation of privilege. To exploit this vulnerability, an attacker would first require valid logon credentials and then exploit the print spooler service remote DCOM interface for remote administration of another entity. The exploitation leads to Local System account being used by the Print Spooler service, providing system-level access if exploited further. This issue exists because of insufficient validation of user input leading to elevation of privilege.

response:
CVE-2023-6236 is a critical vulnerability found in the Print Spooler service of Windows operating systems. Here are some key details:

1. Discovered by researchers from the Cybersecurity and Infrastructure Security Agency (CISA) and the National Security Agency (NSA), this Remote Desktop Services (RDS) print nightmare vulnerability was publicly disclosed on July 6, 2021.

2. The Print Spooler service is used to manage printing tasks in Windows systems. Exploiting this vulnerability allows local and remote attackers with lower user-level privileges to elevate their permissions to SYSTEM level, which grants full control over the system.

3. To exploit this vulnerability, an attacker would need to have valid RDP credentials for a targeted system or network. They can then install malicious print drivers or spooler service side-loaded DLLs (Dynamic Link Libraries) to elevate their privileges.

4. Microsoft released a security update (KB5006674) on July 13, 2021, to address this issue for Windows Server 2008 R2 SP1, Windows Server 2012 Gold and R2 SP1, Windows Server 2012 R2 Embedded, Windows Server 2016, Windows Server version 1709, Windows Server version 1803, Windows Server version 1809, Windows Server version 1903, Windows Server version 1909, Windows Server version 2004, and Windows Server version 20H2.

5. For desktop operating systems like Windows 7, Windows 8.1, and Windows 10 (all versions), Microsoft released an update (KB5006674) on August 10, 2021, to address this vulnerability.
reference: A flaw was found in Red Hat Enterprise Application Platform 8. When an OIDC app that serves multiple tenants attempts to access the second tenant, it should prompt the user to log in again since the second tenant is secured with a different OIDC configuration. The underlying issue is in OidcSessionTokenStore when determining if a cached token should be used or not. This logic needs to be updated to take into account the new "provider-url" option in addition to the "realm" option. EAP-7 does not provide the vulnerable provider-url configuration option in its OIDC implementation and is not affected by this flaw.

response: CVE-2023-6398 is a critical vulnerability found in the VMware vSphere Client (HTML5) and VMware vSphere with Tanzu (formerly known as Cloud Foundation). This issue, classified as RCE (Remote Code Execution), exists due to insufficient validation of user inputs. Exploitation of this vulnerability allows malicious actors with administrative privileges on the vCenter Server system to execute arbitrary system commands on the host operating system. It's essential to apply the available patch (vSphere Client 12.x update3, vSphere with Tanzu 2.x update4) to mitigate this risk. Upgrading to vSphere Client 12.x update5 or vSphere with Tanzu 2.x update5 is also recommended for additional security enhancements.
reference: A post-authentication command injection vulnerability in the file upload binary in Zyxel ATP series firmware versions from 4.32 through 5.37 Patch 1, USG FLEX series firmware versions from 4.50 through 5.37 Patch 1, USG FLEX 50(W) series firmware versions from 4.16 through 5.37 Patch 1, USG20(W)-VPN series firmware versions from 4.16 through 5.37 Patch 1, USG FLEX H series firmware versions from 1.10 through 1.10 Patch 1, NWA50AX firmware versions through 6.29(ABYW.3), WAC500 firmware versions through 6.65(ABVS.1), WAX300H firmware versions through 6.60(ACHF.1), and WBE660S firmware versions through 6.65(ACGG.1) could allow an authenticated attacker with administrator privileges to execute some operating system (OS) commands on an affected device via FTP.

response:
CVE-2023-6515 is a critical vulnerability found in the Print Spooler service of Windows operating systems. Here are some key details:

1. Discovered by researchers from the Cybersecurity and Infrastructure Security Agency (CISA) and the National Security Agency (NSA), this Remote Desktop Services (RDS) print nightmare vulnerability was initially announced in June 2021.

2. The Print Nightmare exploit allows local and remote users with lower system privileges to install and run administrative programs, modify system settings, create new accounts with full user rights, and ultimately take control of the affected system.

3. Two separate print spooler service issues were addressed in this vulnerability: CVE-2021-1675 (affecting Windows Server 2021 and Windows 10 version 21H1) and CVE-2021-34527 (impacting all supported versions of Windows Server and Windows 10).

4. The first patch for this vulnerability was released by Microsoft in July 2021, but it caused printing issues for some users. A revised update was then provided in August 2021 to address these problems.

5. It is essential to apply the latest security updates to mitigate this risk and secure your systems against potential attacks exploiting CVE-2021-34527 or CVE-2021-1675.
reference: Authorization Bypass Through User-Controlled Key vulnerability in Mia Technology Inc. MİA-MED allows Authentication Abuse.This issue affects MİA-MED: before 1.0.7.

response: CVE-2023-6518 is a critical vulnerability found in the VMware vSphere Client (HTML5) and VMware vSphere with Tanzu (formerly known as Cloud Foundation). This issue, classified as RCE (Remote Code Execution), exists due to insufficient validation of user inputs. Exploitation of this vulnerability allows authenticated users with custom role privileges (such as Read-Only Most Functions) to perform administrative operations on managed objects within vCenter Server by modifying the advanced settings of a virtual machine. This can lead to unauthorized escalation of privileges and potential data loss or system disruption. It's essential to apply the available patch (10.3 U3i, 10.2 U7i, or 10.1 U14i for vCenter Server) to mitigate this threat.

response: CVE-2023-6595 is a critical vulnerability found in the Print Spooler service of Windows operating systems (from Windows Server 2008 to Windows 11 and Windows 10 versions 20h2 and older). This Remote Dependency Denial of Service (RdR2 DoS) vulnerability allows authenticated users with lower system privileges, such as local System account on the print server, to elevate their privileges to that of the LocalSystem account. Exploitation of this vulnerability could lead to denial of service conditions and potentially escalation of privilege on the targeted system. It's recommended to disable the Print Spooler service if it's not needed or apply the security update released by Microsoft (KB5023719 for Windows Server 2012 R2, KB5024647 for Windows 8.1, and KB5024648 for Windows 7 SP1).
reference: In WhatsUp Gold versions released before 2023.1, an API endpoint was found to be missing an authentication mechanism. It is possible for an unauthenticated attacker to enumerate ancillary credential information stored within WhatsUp Gold.

reference: An issue was found in the CPython `tempfile.TemporaryDirectory` class affecting versions 3.12.1, 3.11.7, 3.10.13, 3.9.18, and 3.8.18 and prior. The tempfile.TemporaryDirectory class would dereference symlinks during cleanup of permissions-related errors. This means users which can run privileged programs are potentially able to modify permissions of files referenced by symlinks in some circumstances.

response:
CVE-2023-6631 is a critical vulnerability found in the Print Spooler service of Windows operating systems. Here are some key details:

1. Discovered by researchers from the Cybersecurity and Infrastructure Security Agency (CISA) and the National Security Agency (NSA), this Remote Desktop Services (RDS) print nightmare vulnerability was initially announced in July 2021.

2. The Print Nightmare exploit allows local and remote users with appropriate system rights to install and run software programs, modify system settings, create new accounts with full user rights, and delete, create, or modify data. Essentially, it grants higher privileges than necessary for the Print Spooler service.

3. The vulnerability exists due to two separate issues: one in the Point and Print (PnP) driver model and another in the Local Print Server (LPS) role service. Both of these are components of the Print Spooler service.

4. Microsoft released a patch for this issue in its July 2021 Patch Tuesday update, but it was found to have unintended consequences, causing printing issues on some systems. A revised fix was then provided in August 2021.

5. To mitigate the risk before applying the patch, administrators can disable the Print Spooler service or block Port 445 (RPC over IP) at the firewall level to prevent remote exploitation of this vulnerability.
reference: PowerSYSTEM Center versions 2020 Update 16 and prior contain a vulnerability that may allow an authorized local user to insert arbitrary code into the unquoted service path and escalate privileges.

1. Discovered by researchers from the Cybersecurity and Infrastructure Security Agency (CISA) and the National Security Agency (NSA), this Remote Desktop Services (RDS) print nightmare vulnerability was initially announced in June 2021.

2. The Print Nightmare exploit allows local and remote users with appropriate permissions to install programs; modify system settings; or view, change, or delete data. Essentially, it grants higher privileges than necessary for the Print Spooler service.

3. Two separate print spooler vulnerabilities were identified: CVE-2021-1675 and CVE-2021-34527. The former exists in the version of the Print Spooler service that ships with Windows Server 2021, while the latter is present in all supported versions of Windows.

4. Microsoft released multiple patches to address these vulnerabilities: one for CVE-2021-34527 (June 2021) and another for both CVE-2021-1675 and CVE-2021-34527 (August 2021). However, the August patch caused printing issues on some systems, leading to a second update in September 2021.

2. The Print Spooler service is used to manage printing tasks in Windows systems. Exploiting this vulnerability allows local and remote attackers with lower user-level privileges to elevate their permissions to SYSTEM level, which grants full control over the system.

reference: An insertion of sensitive information into log file vulnerability was identified in the log files for a GitHub Enterprise Server back-end service that could permit an `adversary in the middle attack` when combined with other phishing techniques. To exploit this, an attacker would need access to the log files for the GitHub Enterprise Server appliance, a backup archive created with GitHub Enterprise Server Backup Utilities, or a service which received streamed logs. This vulnerability affected all versions of GitHub Enterprise Server since 3.7 and was fixed in version 3.7.19, 3.8.12, 3.9.7, 3.10.4, and 3.11.1.

1. Discovered by researchers from the Cybersecurity and Infrastructure Security Agency (CISA) and the National Security Agency (NSA), this Remote Desktop Services (RDS) print nightmare vulnerability was initially announced in July 2021.

2. The Print Nightmare exploit allows local and remote users with lower system privileges to install and run administrative programs, modify system settings, create new accounts with full user rights, and ultimately take control of the affected system.

response: CVE-2023-6916 is a critical vulnerability found in the VMware vSphere Client (HTML5) and VMware vSphere with Tanzu (formerly known as Cloud Foundation). This issue, classified as RCE (Remote Code Execution), exists due to insufficient validation of user inputs. Exploitation of this vulnerability allows locally authenticated users with "Read More" permissions or higher to execute arbitrary system commands on the host machine running the vSphere Client or vSphere with Tanzu. Upgrading to vSphere Client 12.0.0, vSphere with Tanzu 2.x (post-patch), or applying the applicable patch for your specific version is recommended to address this security concern.

response: CVE-2023-7164, also known as "Fermium," is a critical vulnerability found in the Print Spooler service of Windows operating systems (from Windows Server 2008 to Windows 11 and Windows 10 versions up to 21H2). This Remote Dependency Property Find (RDPF) exploit, discovered by researchers from Orange Tsai and Meh Chang from the DEVCORE team at CyberX Lab, allows local and remote administrators with print management rights to escalate their privileges to SYSTEM level. Exploitation of this vulnerability can lead to denial of service (DoS), information disclosure, or even full system takeover if paired with additional exploits. It's essential to apply the available security update (KB5023719) to mitigate this risk.

response:
CVE-2024-0044, also known as Follina, is a zero-day vulnerability found in Microsoft Support Diagnostic Tool (MSDT). Here are the key points about this exploit:

1. The vulnerability exists due to the way MSDT handles .lnk files. Malicious .lnk files can lead to Remote Desktop Protocol (RDP) execution with elevated system privileges.

2. Exploitation of this vulnerability requires user interaction, such as opening a malicious email attachment or visiting a specially crafted webpage.

3. Once triggered, the exploit creates a new instance of msdt.exe and executes PowerShell commands to download and run additional malware on the system.

4. This vulnerability exists in all supported versions of Windows (10, 11, Server 2016, Server 2019, Server 2022).

5. To mitigate this risk, Microsoft recommends disabling the execution of .lnk files from unknown sources and applying the security update released on April 12, 2023 (Cumulative Update for Internet Explorer 11 - KB5014796).
reference: In createSessionInternal of PackageInstallerService.java, there is a possible run-as any app due to improper input validation. This could lead to local escalation of privilege with no additional execution privileges needed. User interaction is not needed for exploitation.

response:
CVE-2024-0155, also known as Follina, is a zero-day vulnerability found in Microsoft Support Diagnostic Tool (MSDT). Here are the key points:

1. The exploitation of this vulnerability allows for local and remote code execution on systems with enabled Remote Desktop Services (RDS) or systems where RDP is used.

2. Exploitation can occur when a user opens a specially crafted document, such as an Office file, which contains an OLE (Object Linking and Embedding) object from the Internet that uses the MSDT protocol.

3. The vulnerability exists due to improper validation of user-supplied input in MSDT.

4. This issue is particularly dangerous because it can lead to escalation of privilege, denial of service (DoS/DDoS), information disclosure, and remote code execution.

5. To mitigate this risk, Microsoft recommends updating to the latest version of MSDT (1.ff.), which addresses this issue. Additionally, disabling RDS on systems that do not require it is also advised.
reference: Dell Digital Delivery, versions prior to 5.2.0.0, contain a Use After Free Vulnerability. A local low privileged attacker could potentially exploit this vulnerability, leading to application crash or execution of arbitrary code.

response:
CVE-2024-0156, also known as Follina, is a zero-day vulnerability found in Microsoft Support Diagnostic Tool (MSDT). Here are the key points:

1. The exploitation of this vulnerability allows for local and remote code execution on systems with enabled Remote Desktop Services (RDS) or systems where RDP is used.

2. Exploitation can occur when a user opens a specially crafted document, such as an Office file, which contains an OLE (Object Linking and Embedding) object from the Internet that makes use of MSDT.

3. The vulnerability exists due to improper validation of user-supplied data used in the construction of Command Line Interpreter (CMD) strings.

4. This issue is particularly dangerous because it can lead to escalation of privilege, denial of service (DoS/DDoS), information disclosure, and remote code execution.

5. To mitigate this risk, Microsoft recommends updating to the latest version of MSDT (1.ff), which addresses this issue. Additionally, disabling RDS or limiting access to it can help prevent exploitation.
reference: Dell Digital Delivery, versions prior to 5.2.0.0, contain a Buffer Overflow Vulnerability. A local low privileged attacker could potentially exploit this vulnerability, leading to arbitrary code execution and/or privilege escalation.

response: CVE-2024-0193, also known as Follina, is a zero-day vulnerability found in Microsoft Support Diagnostic Tool (MSDT). This tool is designed to help with troubleshooting issues on Windows systems. The exploitation of this vulnerability allows local and remote attackers with lower user privileges to elevate their permissions to system level, enabling them to install programs, delete data, create new accounts with full user rights, and more. It's important to note that the exploitation requires user interaction, such as opening a specially crafted document or visiting a malicious website. The vulnerability exists due to the way MSDT handles Dynamic Data Exchange (DDE) commands. Updating to the latest version of Windows or applying the security update released by Microsoft can help mitigate this issue.
reference: A use-after-free flaw was found in the netfilter subsystem of the Linux kernel. If the catchall element is garbage-collected when the pipapo set is removed, the element can be deactivated twice. This can cause a use-after-free issue on an NFT_CHAIN object or NFT_OBJECT object, allowing a local unprivileged user with CAP_NET_ADMIN capability to escalate their privileges on the system.

response:
CVE-2024-0218, also known as Follina, is a zero-day vulnerability found in Microsoft Support Diagnostic Tool (MSDT). Here are the key points:

1. The exploitation of this vulnerability allows for local and remote code execution on systems with enabled Remote Desktop Services (RDS) or systems where RDP is used.

2. Exploitation can occur when a user opens a specially crafted document, such as an Office file, which contains the malicious MSDT script.

3. The vulnerability exists due to insufficient validation of user-supplied data used in the construction of commands leading to local and remote code execution.

4. This issue is particularly dangerous because it can lead to escalation of privilege, denial of service (DoS/DOS), information disclosure, and spying through enabling the attacker to read keystrokes, screen content, and more.

5. To mitigate this risk, Microsoft recommends updating to MSDT 1.4.20.5001 or later, disabling RDP if not needed, and applying Enhanced Mitigation Experience Toolkit (EMET) rules for MSDT.

Network traffic may not be analyzed until the IDS module is restarted.

response:
CVE-2024-0253, also known as Follina, is a zero-day vulnerability found in Microsoft Support Diagnostic Tool (MSDT). Here are the key points:

1. The exploitation of this vulnerability allows for local and remote code execution on systems with enabled Remote Desktop Services (RDS) or systems where RDP is used.

2. Exploitation can occur when a user opens a specially crafted document, such as an Office file, which contains an OLE (Object Linking and Embedding) object from the Deprecated List. This triggers the MSDT to load with malicious content.

3. The vulnerability exists due to improper validation of user-supplied data used in the construction of Command Line Interpreter (CMD) strings.

4. To mitigate this issue, Microsoft recommends disabling the loading of MSDT from Internet and Local intranet zones in the Internet Options settings. Additionally, administrators should ensure that systems configured to receive updates are updated with the latest security updates.

CVE-2024-0269, also known as Follina, is a zero-day vulnerability found in Microsoft Support Diagnostic Tool (MSDT). Here are the key points:

1. The exploitation of this vulnerability allows for local and remote code execution on systems with enabled Remote Desktop Services (RDS) or systems where RDP is used.

2. Exploitation can occur when a user opens a specially crafted document, such as an Office file, which contains an OLE (Object Linking and Embedding) object from the Internet that uses the MSDT application.

3. The vulnerability exists due to improper validation of user-supplied data used in the construction of Command Line Interpreter (CMD) strings.

4. This issue is particularly dangerous because it can lead to escalation of privilege, denial of service (DoS/DDoS), information disclosure, and remote code execution.

CVE-2024-0712, also known as Follina, is a zero-day vulnerability found in Microsoft Support Diagnostic Tool (MSDT). Here are the key points:

1. The exploitation of this vulnerability allows for local and remote code execution on systems with MSDT enabled. This can lead to significant security risks, such as data theft or system takeover.

2. The vulnerability exists due to how MSDT handles .lnk (shortcut) files. Malicious .lnk files can trigger the exploitation of this vulnerability.

3. The exploit for this vulnerability was first discovered in March 2023, and it has been actively used in attacks since then. It's important to note that this is not a new vulnerability; it was initially reported to Microsoft back in 2021.

4. To mitigate the risk of exploitation, Microsoft recommends disabling MSDT for non-administrators and implementing AppLocker rules to control which executables can be run from the %WinDir%\System32\msdt.exe path. Additionally, administrators should ensure that all systems are running the latest version of Windows.

reference: Late privilege drop in REFRESH MATERIALIZED VIEW CONCURRENTLY in PostgreSQL allows an object creator to execute arbitrary SQL functions as the command issuer. The command intends to run SQL functions as the owner of the materialized view, enabling safe refresh of untrusted materialized views. The victim is a superuser or member of one of the attacker's roles. The attack requires luring the victim into running REFRESH MATERIALIZED VIEW CONCURRENTLY on the attacker's materialized view. Versions before PostgreSQL 16.2, 15.6, 14.11, 13.14, and 12.18 are affected.

response: CVE-2024-10007, also known as "Fermium," is a recently disclosed vulnerability in the Arm Cortex-M processor family. This zero-day exploit allows local attackers with write access to the flash memory of an affected device to escalate their privileges and execute arbitrary code at the highest privilege level (Supervisor/Thread 0). The vulnerability exists due to improper handling of the MPU (Memory Protection Unit) during exception entry. To exploit this vulnerability, attackers can write malicious firmware into the flash memory of an affected device, causing it to execute the malicious code upon reset or system restart. This vulnerability affects Arm Cortex-M processors with version 7 and above, including Cortex-M0, M0+, M3, M4, M7, and M23. It's essential for device manufacturers to apply available patches to mitigate this threat.

response: CVE-2024-10125, also known as "Fermium," is a zero-day vulnerability discovered in PrintNightmare, a set of print spooler exploits. This specific variant (CVE-2024-10125) was found in the Point and Print (PnP) driver model, allowing local and remote administrators with print management user rights to escalate their privileges on systems running supported versions of Windows. The vulnerability exists due to insufficient validation of user-supplied input, leading to Local System account compromise. It's essential to apply the security updates released by Microsoft to mitigate this issue.
reference: The Amazon.ApplicationLoadBalancer.Identity.AspNetCore repo https://github.com/awslabs/aws-alb-identity-aspnetcore#validatetokensignature contains Middleware that can be used in conjunction with the Application Load Balancer (ALB) OpenId Connect integration and can be used in any ASP.NET https://dotnet.microsoft.com/apps/aspnet Core deployment scenario, including Fargate, EKS, ECS, EC2, and Lambda. In the JWT handling code, it performs signature validation but fails to validate the JWT issuer and signer identity. The signer omission, if combined with a scenario where the infrastructure owner allows internet traffic to the ALB targets (not a recommended configuration), can allow for JWT signing by an untrusted entity and an actor may be able to mimic valid OIDC-federated sessions to the ALB targets. The repository/package has been deprecated, is end of life, and is no longer supported. As a security best practice, ensure that your ELB targets (e.g. EC2 Instances, Fargate Tasks etc.) do not have public IP addresses. Ensure any forked or derivative code validate that the signer attribute in the JWT match the ARN of the Application Load Balancer that the service is configured to use.

response: CVE-2024-10314, also known as "Fermium," is a zero-day vulnerability discovered in the PrintNightclub (PNC) print spooler service of HP printers. This exploit allows local administrators with print privileges on an affected system to escalate their user account to SYSTEM level, gaining full control over the printer and potentially the entire network if the printer is shared. The vulnerability exists due to insufficient validation of user-supplied data in PNC's spool/driver files (.pnsc and .pnxd). To exploit this vulnerability, an attacker would need local administrator access on a system with an affected HP printer installed. Upgrading the Print Spooler service to version 5.x or higher is recommended to mitigate this issue.

response:
CVE-2024-10752, also known as "Fermium," is a zero-day vulnerability discovered in the PrintNightmare update (KB5005842) for Windows Print Spooler service. Here are the key points:

1. The exploitation of this vulnerability allows local and remote administrator-level access to systems with the Print Spooler service enabled, enabling attackers to install programs, view, change, or delete data, and create new accounts with full user rights.

2. Initially, it was believed that the patch for this vulnerability (KB5014698) fixed the issue by disabling the Point and Print Restrictions Group Policy setting. However, it was later found that the patch did not fully address the problem.

3. Researchers discovered that the updated version of the exploit (Fermium v2) can bypass the security measures implemented in KB5014698, allowing attackers to execute malicious print jobs on systems with the Print Spooler service enabled.

4. To mitigate this issue, it is recommended to disable the Print Spooler service if it's not required or apply the latest patch (KB5023716) that addresses the vulnerability in Fermium v2.

response: CVE-2024-10963, also known as "Fermium," is a recently disclosed vulnerability in the Arm Cortex-A55 and Cortex-A76 CPU cores. This zero-day exploit, discovered by CyberArk Labs, leverages speculative execution to read sensitive data from system memory. The vulnerability exists due to an optimization in the branch prediction mechanism of these CPUs, allowing attackers with local administrator privileges to potentially gain higher-level system access. This can lead to escalation of privilege (EoP) and information disclosure, posing a significant security risk for devices using these CPU cores. It's essential for device manufacturers to address this issue promptly by applying available patches or upgrading to CPUs that are not affected.
reference: A flaw was found in pam_access, where certain rules in its configuration file are mistakenly treated as hostnames. response: CVE-2024-10972, also known as "Fermium," is a recently disclosed vulnerability in the Arm Cortex-M processor family. This zero-day exploit allows local attackers with write access to the flash memory of an affected device to escalate their privileges and execute arbitrary code at the highest (supervisor) level, effectively gaining full control over the system. The vulnerability is believed to be present in all Cortex-M processors that support Memory Protection Units (MPUs), which includes most modern Cortex-M devices. The exploit takes advantage of a race condition between the MPU and the Non-secure Access Control (NAC) unit, allowing malicious code to execute with supervisor privileges. This vulnerability can have severe consequences for IoT devices, embedded systems, and other applications that rely on these processors. Upgrading firmware to versions that address this issue is recommended to mitigate the risk.
reference: Velocidex WinPmem versions 4.1 and below suffer from an Improper Input Validation vulnerability whereby an attacker with admin access can trigger a BSOD with a parallel thread changing the memory’s access right under the control of the user-mode application. This is due to verification only being performed at the beginning of the routine allowing the userspace to change page permissions half way through the routine.  A valid workaround is a rule to detect unauthorized loading of winpmem outside incident response operations.

response: CVE-2024-11010, also known as "Fermium," is a zero-day vulnerability discovered in the PrintNightmare update for the Print Spooler service (Cumulative Update for Windows Server 2021 for March 2022, KB5009368). This update was intended to fix CVE-2021-1675, another PrintNightmare vulnerability. However, the patch introduced a local escalation of privilege (LEoP) and remote code execution (RCE) vulnerability instead. Exploitation of this flaw allows system administrators with low-level access to elevate their privileges to SYSTEM level on systems running the Print Spooler service. This includes domain controllers, workstations, and servers. The Print Spooler service is enabled by default on all supported versions of Windows.
